appwidget module

class appwidget.AppWidget(id)

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QWidget

Class for the app widget added to the main window.

removed

Signal to be sent to main window when the remove button is clicked.

Type

pyqtSignal

id

The App ID saved in the database.

Type

int

name

The application name.

Type

str

path

The application file path.

Type

str

command

Additional command to be executed on before launching the app.

Type

str

arg

Arguments for launching the app.

Type

str

env

System environment variables.

Type

QProcessEnvironment

arg: str = ''
command: str = ''
edit()

Function for Edit button. It displays an Edit Dialog with exisitng data. Replace the data with new data if editted. Otherwise, remove the newly added environment variables and get the previously saved ones.

env: PyQt5.QtCore.QProcessEnvironment = <PyQt5.QtCore.QProcessEnvironment object>
get_data()

Function for getting data from the database and set the icon to the launch button.

id: int = None
launch()

Run the additional commands, set environment variables and launch the app.

name: str = ''
path: str = ''
remove()

Function for the Remove button. It displays a message box to confirm the action. Remove the data from the database and emit the removed signal if confirmed.

removed
replace_env(text)

Replace environment variables in a text with the actual values.

Returns

text – Replaced text.

Return type

str

run_commands(commands)

Run the additional commands. It runs backtick commands first and replace the returned value with the commands.

Returns

True if commands are successfully executed, otherwise False.

Return type

bool
